intro: Ruschia piscodora, commonly known as the coastal Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its vibrant flowers and unique adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and yellow, typically blooming in spring. Ruschia piscodora thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
